intro: Toussaintia orientalis, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
